Author: Moftwell
Comment: Very excited about the implementation of foveated rendering on PSVR2. That could be gamechanging; an absolutely massive deal. The scale offered by Hello Games supporting full-game VR for NMS has always been beyond reproach, but the visual sharpness (particularly in the mid-distance and beyond) has maybe just held it back from breaking through the top-tier of PSVR2 games. If HG have managed to crack that here‚Ä¶ I really need to try this update when I get home! And as always, the other updates are a mix of improvements, iterations and reimaginings that partly offer the playerbase cool things they were asking for and partly offers even cooler things they‚Äôd never thought about. Everyone knows the story of NMS by now, but Hello Games continue to build their exemplary reputation for post-launch support. Happy seventh birthday, Sean. Your team fully deserves the celebrations.

Author: Moftwell
Comment: Quick explainer of how time works for MrXile: The state of a game at launch is a result of work done prior to launch. Improvements made to a game after launch is a result of work done after launch. This concept is pretty basic. Yep, we all know how the game was during that first year. But by that point the developers had begun working on the post-launch improvements. NMS launched seven years ago. Thus, it has been seven years of amazing work to reach the point the game‚Äôs at now, and it‚Äôs possible to hold both that opinion and the opinion that the game wasn‚Äôt good on release. Seems weird to consider ‚Äòthey made the game better now than it was at launch‚Äô as blinkered, but I get it; words can be difficult.

Author: GunMetalManxx
Comment: Wow. There used to be three buttons on the side of the controller to mimic grip of individual fingers, and they cut them? In a time where gamers want more buttons. I guess they figured people would accidentally push the buttons and they more of a hinderance rather than a benefit when you couldn‚Äôt see your hands freely to know. [Shrugs] Fair enough. Man, Sony‚Äôs gotta do something. They were riding a wave when Jack Tretton was running things. Andrew House was the group CEO but the mindset changed. It was sad off the shelf parts were being used, PlayStation wasn‚Äôt innovative anymore and Microsoft‚Äôs hardware was pretty much identical, just felt like you were buying Sony‚Äôs version of a PC only, apparently it wasn‚Äôt cutting edge anymore because, even now, this console generation is about half over and we‚Äôve seen nothing new from: Naughty Dog, Bend, barely from Polyphony, etc as everything is still on PS4. It‚Äôs feeling like the PS2 did having to supplement the loss of every PS3 sold to hoping the PS2 sale would recoup the loss. There‚Äôs nothing really to play on PS5. Horizon, Spider-man, Gran Turismo, God of War, The Show (come on Sony how could you screw that up and allow your IP to be on Xbox and Nintendo. What‚Äôve they done for you?), what‚Äôs the real motivation to bug a PS5? It was said during the PS3 era: ‚ÄúWhat‚Äôs the point in investing in Sony if they can‚Äôt even hang on to their exclusives?‚Äù As mentioned, The Show is developed BY SONY and is on Xbox and Nintendo. May as well release on PC as well. PlayStation gave up on Metal Gear Solid. Forever, Metal Gear was synonymous with PlayStation. Then Metal Gear Solid 3 starting popping up on Nintendo 3DS, THEN XBOX. Xbox 360 starting getting Metal Gear games and the only title PlayStation has managed to hang onto is Metal Gear Solid 4, but that‚Äôs already been said to come to Xbox hardware. Don Mattrick stole Final Fantasy XIII and now they‚Äôve gone for the jugular with Activision taking Tony Hawk, CRASH BANDICOOT (HEY PLUMBER BOY, MUSTACHE MAN, YOUR WORST NIGHTMARE HSS ARRIVED.) THE PSX version of Crash games, can be on Game Pass now. Naughty Dogs games go to Game Pass. Spyro goes to Game Pass. You were so worried about Call of Duty, you forgot about the possibility of anything. Potential StarCraft Ghost being the new Halo or Perfect Dark.  AND YOU HAVE BUNGIE! You have the one studio that knows how to combat Halo because they are Halo, but that can all be multiplatform too. PlayStation, youve gotten to complacent and too comfortable and I guess Xbox is going to have to wake you up again. Exclusives you used to have are slipping away. Timed exclusives aren‚Äôt going to cut it. As a PlayStation fan, I learned to be patient as Xbox games came to PlayStation. You think Xbox fans can‚Äôt be or aren‚Äôt the same? They‚Äôll play something else knowing in a years time, they‚Äôll play it on their console of choice. I was patient enough for Phantasy Star Online 2 that STARTED OUT ON PS HARDWARE. You‚Äôve gotten complacent again. Xbox is gonna take MGS4, Xbots can wait for Silent Hill 2 and they will, Starfield will keep them entertained in the meantime. The PlayStation Showcase? You sold what gamers could see on Xbox Series S/X in the coming years. That should‚Äôve been a pre-show. You didn‚Äôt tell the gaming world why THEY NEEDED TO HAVE A PS5. There were no exclusives. Third-party games and TIMED exclusives. That doesn‚Äôt tell me why I have to have PlayStation. Xbox immediately afterward said: ‚ÄúYeah, we‚Äôre gonna have that too.‚Äù You did the marketing for them so they could show off why I need Xbox. Get it together PlayStation. Under Andrew House with Jack Tretton as his right hand man, PlayStation was a force to be reckoned with. Nobody cares what‚Äôs going on in Europe. Eyes are on the US, that‚Äôs why PlayStation H.Q. had been moved to San Francisco (Californias a crappy state with much better surrounding areas), but Jim Ryan seems like he‚Äôs just waiting to be knighted when he hasn‚Äôt seen a battlefield, hasn‚Äôt risked his life. Just sit in his leather chair and sip his bourbon. Pick your junk up and sew it back on. Get it done.

Author: GutsBerserker
Comment: I absolutely love VR and I‚Äôm glad Sony is still supporting it with an awesome device that is the PSVR2 and the Dual Senses. Without Sony there would still be 0 (zero!) VR on the console market, let that sink in for a minute. Nintendo cardboard doesn‚Äôt count obviously, come on. Yet I was disappointed with the substantial comfort downgrade the PSVR2 offers compared to the almost perfect PSVR, at least for my face/head shape, it‚Äôs really a shame. The sweet spot is also smaller and more difficult to keep than on PSVR1. On the software side of things I just really hope Sony has some new games up their sleeves, because they need to continue supporting PSVR2 with their own studios, relying on 3rd party and Oculus ports alone will not suffice, especially if you want to show off the power of the PS5 and foveated rendering.You could start with bringing back Astro Bot and the WipEout collection to PSVR2 and then finally release that COLONY WARS PSVRemake. The Last of Us remake should have been fully playable on PSVR2, it‚Äôs a missed opportunity.

I love my psvr2 and play with it almost every day. But I have two points of criticism where I hope for improvement in the future. Firstly, there is the very, very short runtime of the Dual Sense Controller. When me and my VR Boys & Girls match online,it may take longer. Unfortunately, after intensive games, you get out of the flow after about two hours because you then have to charge the controllers, I think that works better or you still offer the controllers for sale so that you can switch to a second pair.The second point of criticism is the scanning of the play area. If I scan in the evening, it is no longer recognized during the day and vice versa. This is a little annoying! My wish for the future: Please bring a new Astrobot and wipeout for this amazing machine. There are also so many gamers (myself included) who still haven‚Äôt been able to play Half Life Alyx. What is the point of all this progress, when gamers like myself can‚Äôt play PS VR2 games that use less than native 90 frames per second frame rates without becoming sick and stopping each time? The native frame rates of PS VR2 games should be clearly advertised on the PlayStation Store, and performance modes should be offered in-game to increase native frame rates and alleviate sickness as a result of reprojected frame rate motion blur. I hope that if a PS5 ‚ÄòPRO‚Äô is released in future that at the very least, the extra power will be used to fix these striking flaws.

Author: GreyMatterShades
Comment: If you‚Äôre struggling with motion sickness, playing for short sessions is a good idea, as it‚Äôs best to stop before or as soon as you feel sick. Also having a fan blowing on you can help a lot, as can playing games where you aren‚Äôt using analog sticks to move. Finally, games with high refresh rates without reprojection are less likely to make you feel sick. Games like Demeo, Job/Vacation Sim, Moss 1+2, Pavlov, Pistol Whip, Puzzling Places, Red Matter 2, Rez Infinite, Runner, Song in the Smoke Remastered, both Walking Dead games, The Last Clockwinder, The Light Brigade, and Thumper all run at 90Hz at least, so they‚Äôd be less likely to make you feel ill. There could be more, but it can be tough to find this info for everything. Hope this helps.

Author: blankbramble

I would be more than willing to invest if they managed to make it a handheld digital-only PS4 fine-tuned to stream PS5 games, especially considering the PS4 is already more than capable of remote playing PS5 games. I really don‚Äôt think the design helps its case: a large screen shoved into the middle of a controller doesn‚Äôt exactly seem ergonomic or portable. The biggest blow for me is the lack of an OLED screen, especially considering the Vita had it nearly 10 years prior. I suppose the price still remains to be seen, but with the licensed Backbone accessory costing $100 alone, I don‚Äôt see this being reasonably-priced enough for it to be a worthwhile proposition to most people; even if it works as seamlessly as a certain other console‚Äôs ‚Äúgamepad‚Äù accessory, it seems far too niche to really catch on. I‚Äôd love for Sony to continue pursuing handhelds, and I understand they want to allocate all their development to big-budget games on their core system, but this doesn‚Äôt seem like the right way to go about it.

Author: KazeEternal
Comment: Wifi exclusive Project Q? I got a wishlist for you: 1) Give USB-C hub support for wired Connections. I do this with my phone to get a much more stable connection to my PS5 when remote playing. WiFi in my house is ok and will be getting a Wifi6 overhaul eventually, but my 1gig network is better suited and works great with my PS4 and Phone when remote playing my PS5. 2) Make this sucker have a dock. Not just a charging dock, but a TV dock. I want to be able to dock this device to my TV and allow me to have a full PS5 like experience, using an actual dual sense. No need to go crazy with detachable groups that attach to a controller dock with a touch pad in the middle (though appreciated). If I‚Äôm playing in another room away from my PS5 and the TV suddenly becomes free in that room and I don‚Äôt want to go to the other room, it would be nice to just dock and play. I‚Äôd buy multiples of these docks for each room with a TV if this was a thing.  A lower cost charging dock without all the bells and whistled would be a nice accessory as well. 3) I‚Äôm already asking for Dual Sense support in number 2, so this should be a natural fit. Bluetooth support for multiple devices. Headsets, controllers, keyboards. etc I want it all. Look overall I‚Äôd rather have a PS Vita 2 with backward compatibility with digital PS4 games. If this thing is going to be what I think it is, we‚Äôre looking at a 200 dollar product which is going to make people ask ‚Äúwhy didn‚Äôt you just make a Vita 2?‚Äù I doubt it‚Äôll be 100 dollars like the backbone. My little wishlist here will certainly push that price up. So go the distance, don‚Äôt stop short like with the Vita (no tv out and stupid touch screen, zero innovation to adopt Dual Shock 3/4 layout) and PSP (lacking a second analog stick and again no TV out or Dual Shock support till PSP Go which was a dumb move to do to the PSP2000 and 3000).

Author: CommandingTiger
Comment: The Asus ROG Ally that has similar Teraflops as a PS5 is retailing at 700$. I don‚Äôt see how they could be able to make a system as powerful as a PS5 on a mobile device and not charge the same if not more than a PS5. Which is probably why they have this Q Lite as a stand-alone device because you can put in different powered hardware attached to the back of this Q Lite device. So if you‚Äôre only willing to spend 400$, you‚Äôd get a portable device as powerful as a PS4 Pro (that‚Äôs with the Q-Lite), but won‚Äôt play PS5 games.  You want the bigger hardware, then you‚Äôre spending more on this device to get a full PS5 out of it. Then you‚Äôre probably looking at 600$ in total minimum. I totally agree with you that we need a new PSP type device,  Sony however will Not make any other games than their AAA for console nor compromise the experience. However, we‚Äôre not dealing with completely different architecture, it would be all Ryzen and basically run all the same games, except in a portable way. If you just want the Q-Lite, you‚Äôd basically stream games either via Remote Play or Cloud Streaming with PS5 server blades, these are coming down the line so that‚Äôs why they are waiting to show more on the device. Depending if they get the patents, they can make the dual sense controller detachable onto a middle portion holding the touchpad similar to Nintendo Switch. The good thing about the Q-Lite is that you can keep this device and just upgrade the hardware that runs games separately from the 9 inch OLED screen. So if a PS6 version comes up, then it would be cheaper than buying a whole new device. -Replaceable battery is a must.-Hall effect sensor analogs is a must, reduces cost by fixing stick drift.

Author: ozgamer16
Comment: They are all working double time because of Jim Ryan‚Äôs PC first requirements. They care more about PC platform than their own hardware. I know users on this blog refuse to believe this and feel I just throw this out there from nowhere, but this was spelled out very clearly in their 2022 and 2023 fiscal year reporting for the gaming segment. Worst part of all is that their sales on the PC platform were utterly laughable when they are exchanging those sales for their future console ecosystem sales. Other platforms recognise the value of exclusives, but somehow the company that is supposed to focused on ‚Äúgiving gamers exclusive experiences‚Äù has lost that approach. PlayStation executives are business first and gamers last ‚Äì exactly the way it was with Kaz Hirai leading into the PS3 generation. Problem is that they think it is working due to the boom that came with the pandemic.

Author: stage300handsome
Comment: I see a lot always say we gamer‚Äôs that have grew up with PlayStation since its start have changed, I don‚Äôt agree with that at all. I think studios are the change, they are full of people who are creative, but like Hollywood have run out of ideals for the most part and as a company they are no longer concerned with your feedback on anything, they assume they have your business, and they pander to other crowds that aren‚Äôt really loyal to the brand or experience. Square Enix a great studio, and I‚Äôm looking forward to a lot of their titles, but I think they lost their magic of always coming up with titles that interest the base now because they try to do to much to please western audiences, when in truth the ones that will buy a title preorder or day one are not looking for western styles.And that brings me to the point now with this State of Play that I finally got around to watching because most of them the past yr haven‚Äôt been good or having something your wanting to see, even though Baldur‚Äôs and a few of the other single player rpgs and action adventures looked good , so much pushing the sucide squad and online ones along with the woke stuff, really kind of brought it done. But that is the best thing out what Sony is that during the Ps1 and 2 its was full of any genre you wanted. There‚Äôs still just as much variety as then but they all lean toward the same thing wanting online and free for all.I have two sons who like to game and for the past few yrs its been Fortnite and CoD nonstop back and forth all day that they can, and I have every system from the late 80‚Äôs up to now. And they have sat and played around with them in the past or sat and watched me, it was usually that looks boring or it cheats so bad, looks rough. But now that they have gotten older, I will see them try some different games here and there, and was really shocked to learn they got Legend of Dragoon and Wild Arms and been playing them the past few weeks. But apparently, they didn‚Äôt realize I had the originals. I found out by taking them out to Game Stop and a few local used gaming stores, they were looking where I was looking and I said guys used passed by the C‚Äôs already, then I heard my youngest ask a worker if they  had chrono trigger for Ps4 or 5 and I was like I got that at home if you want to play it, but its not on the newest consoles. They then came up asking questions about others, so they must have been researching or seen others watching their youtube videos on the games they play, I still don‚Äôt get that, but was kind of glad  they were trying some of my favorites now. And for the last month I haven‚Äôt heard shooting or all the Fortnite crazy sounds coming from their room. But Hey, maybe we will find out what Bluepoint has going on soon, or Insomniac‚Äôs known games like Spiderman or Wolverine since those guys at least get how to make superhero games, or maybe Ronin or one of the FF games coming up. I figure State of Decay will continue on like the monthly games on Plus, a once in a while shock you month.

Street Fighter 6 gameplay looks unique adding three more characters, and a Naruto Ultimate Storm game, could be a remastered version of past Ultimate Ninja Storm games from the PS2/3 years. If it‚Äôs getting remastered, sign me up and take my money. As for the rest, well‚Ä¶about the new trailer for the game, Suicide Squad Kills The Justice League. We were all skeptical (and excited) for the game, Kevin Conroy‚Äôs final performance as Batman will be emotional and heartbreaking saying goodbye to one of the most beloved actor portraying The Dark Knight for 30 years. And what do you get‚Ä¶ a janky gameplay version that feels like Gotham Knights, but man. What a way to botched your State Of Play event. Wasn‚Äôt a bad show, but it‚Äôs need to do a lot better. Author: persona1138
Comment: Got my PSVR2 today and having issues with the Sense controllers in games.  Horizon, Star Wars, etc. upon start of the game seem to think that the face buttons of the Right Sense controller are on the left.  And the Options button doesn‚Äôt work at all in games. In the PS5 Home System menus, the Sense controllers work fine.  This is ONLY an issue within games themselves. Removing the Sense controllers from Accessories and re-adding them doesn‚Äôt work. The only solution I‚Äôve found is to start a game, then within that game, take off my headset, and use a tiny pin to poke the reset hole in each controller for 5 seconds each to reset the Sense controllers.  Then, after they‚Äôve both been reset and disconnected, hit the PlayStation button on my Right Sense controller, and then the Left Sense Controller to reconnect (while still in the game I want to play), and then they work properly. Please note that if I close the game and restart it ‚Äì OR, if I select a different game entirely ‚Äì this process will need to be repeated. The other solution is to completely turn off the PS5.  Start it up, and use ONLY my DualSense controller.  Start the game with the DualSense controller.  And THEN turn on the Right and then Left Sense controllers within the game.  That works too. But in any case, this is unacceptable.  PLEASE FIX!

Author: KazeEternal
Comment: So not sure if my lenses in the headset are the problem or its just me. However I have a stigmatism in my right eye, that becomes painfully obvious when I put the VR headset on. I think it is impart causing me motion sickness. I do not have this blurriness in th ePSVR or the Oculus Rift S. I tihnk it might have something to do with the fresnel lenses used in the PSVR2. Not against getting glasses just for my PSVR2, but I‚Äôm wondering if this was taken into account during development. My eyes automatically correct for the warpped blurriness when my left eye is open. So not sure what‚Äôs going on here. I‚Äôm not sure what to blame for the nausea. Horizon I was doing fine until I turned with the right analog stick or needed to turn the camera while climbing. This made me sick and had me laid out for a good 2 hours for a 45 minute play session. Keep in mind it feels better than Doom VfR on PSVR when moveing forward, backward, left or right (strafing), but was absolutely miserable when rotating my Body Yaw. Pitch. Yaw, and Roll of headset were fine (moving  the head set up or down, tilting my head). I think the blurriness combined to what ever curves are being appled to th eright analog stick are what is causing my issues. Something to consider. Horizon might be able to be patched, but the blurriness might be another problem altogether.

Nobody is against the idea of Nintendo getting access to Call of Duty, everyone is on board with that.It‚Äôs the 10 years part.‚ÄúWe will bring Call of Duty to other platforms‚Äù, but only for ten years‚Ä¶After that, it‚Äôs no longer about bringing access to Call of Duty on more platforms.Which makes absolutely no sense for Xbox or Microsoft to Not bring Call of Duty to other platforms for more than 10 years and make more money but they aren‚Äôt in the business of making money with Xbox, so there‚Äôs that. The real argument is the limited time being offered, after which it becomes exclusive. By stating it publicly, they can‚Äôt go back on what they‚Äôve said and change their story to ‚Äúwell, we meant available everywhere forever‚Äù. Playstation can‚Äôt be arrogant or complacent either, but the argument to get people into your ecosystem is by creating games franchise from first party, not by buying everyone‚Äôs successful franchises. It worked well for Nintendo and their IPs. It was a smart move to keep Destiny and Bungie as multi-platform, monetary wise too but it shows good faith from PlayStation that they aren‚Äôt removing games from other platforms unlike Xbox.

Author: CommandingTiger
Comment: Microsoft will claim.  ‚ÄúBut Nintendo signed the deal and they‚Äôre OK with that!‚ÄùTo which you can easily respond to the many quotes of every Nintendo President claiming that Nintendo is Not in direct competition with Xbox or PlayStations.By their own words, tit would not matter to them either way because Nintendo does Nintendo stuff. Sell their own games and the rest is not as relevant.But of course, you can congratulate Nintendo on getting Call of Duty and tell them you want Call of Duty on Nintendo consoles not just for 10 years but forever.

Author: Graffin_G
Comment: There‚Äôs a lot of confusion over this title. I bought what was labelled PS4 & PS5 version, but only received the PS5 download with the PS4/PSVR1 version still showing full price ($40.95 AUD). I reached out to PlayStation Support here in Australia, this was their response‚Ä¶ ‚ÄúAfter investigating your query further, we can confirm that the PlayStation 4 and 5 versions of this game are only available separately, and the PlayStation Store has since been updated to reflect this. If you were intending to purchase the PlayStation 4 version of this game, then we will be happy to offer a refund your purchase. ‚Äù They‚Äôve now edited their product descriptions to remove any wording that implied the PS4/PS5 versions were Cross-Buy. They are Cross-Buy on PC (between Oculus and Quest), and I believe the devs intended to have the same happen on the PlayStation ‚Äì but, i‚Äôve posted on Twitter and the posts are ignored. I‚Äôve asked on their Discord, and others say there‚Äôs a miscommunication with Sony that the devs are aware of but no time frame on a fix. It‚Äôs infuriating. I though I could play the PS5 version with PSVR2 and my housemate could play the PS4 version with my original PSVR1 headset as was promised by both the developer and PlayStation at time of purchase. They can‚Äôt just retroactively edit that description and say nope‚Ä¶ have a refund if you want, but you can only have one version.

Author: xscapeguy2007
Comment: Sony Group Corp. reduced projections for the initial launch of its PlayStation VR2 headset dramatically after early pre-orders disappointed, signaling little improvement for the hyped-but-unproven virtual reality sector. The company halved its forecast for shipments of the PSVR2, which is set for a Feb. 22 release, this quarter to about a million units, said people familiar with its deliberations. Sony had previously aimed to have 2 million headsets ready for the launch quarter and leverage its second-generation headset to drive user growth and adoption for VR. The Tokyo-based electronics giant has told a supply partner to expect reduced display panel orders, according to the people, who asked not to be named as the information is not public. The company now plans to ship around 1.5 million units between this April and March next year, they added, though that figure may be adjusted further in response to demand. Hope this is wrong but its hurting pre orders now. Chante it would be good if guerilla/firesprite made a road map what is to come from playstation studios going forward after COTM and Gt7. Hope some one actually answers this.
